Kinkele Friedrich A. Kinkele (1949 - 2012) übernimmt 1977 Familienbetrieb. Andreas Kinkele Nach Weltkrieg übernimmt 1914 geborene Andreas Kinkele Betrieb Vaters. Neue Fräsmaschinen Schweißgeräte angeschafft, Betrieb ausgebaut, modernisiert Richtung Maschinenbau Reparatur entwickelt. Meisterbrief 1941 Am 28. Januar 1941 erhielt Andreas Kinkele , älteste Sohn Karl Kinkeles, Meisterbrief Handwerkskammer Würzburg. Meisterbrief 1913 Am 15. November 1913 erhielt Karl Kinkele offiziell Meisterbrief für Schlosser Handwerk. Karl Kinkele Karl Kinkele übernimmt väterlichen Schlossereibetrieb übersiedelt Straße "Im Zwinger 12" Ochsenfurt. Die Anfänge In Werkstatt Stefan Kinkeles entstehen Linie Tresore/Kassaschränke/feuerfeste Tabernakel Dezimalwaagen für Landwirtschaft. Stefan Kinkele Stefan Kinkele gründet 1885 Ochsenfurt Spitalgasse 13 Schlossereibetrieb KINKELE. Die Jahre Firma Kinkele Die Ochsenfurter Firma Kinkele Jahre 1885 gegründet . In dreigeteilten Montagehalle Lage, Spektrum Maschinenbau montieren – wuchtigen Anlage filigranen Kleinteil. Das Ergebnis: (Sonder-) Maschinen, Anlagen Aggregate Hydraulik- Pneumatik-Steuerungen diversen Ausführungen. Groß- Anlagenmontage (2.250 m 2 ) Länge 100 m | Breite 22,5 m | Hallenhöhe 17,5 m | Kranhakenhöhe 14 m Hier Maschinen(-teile), Vorrichtungen Anlagen Stückgewichten 70 Tonnen montiert, verkabelt Wunsch unseren Fachleuten Betrieb genommen. Aufgrund Hallenhöhe höheren Stückgewichten Autokraneinsätze problemlos möglich. Vakuum- Fördertechnik (1.080 m 2 ) Länge 48 m | Breite 22,5m | Hallenhöhe 10 m | Kranhakenhöhe 8,50 m Hier montieren Maschinen, Maschinenteile, Vorrichtungen komplette Anlagen Stückgewichten 50 Tonnen. Kleinmontage Länge 24 m | Breite 15 m | Höhe 5,50 m | Kranhakenhöhe 4,30 m In Montagebereich präzise zu – montieren Maschinenteile, hohe Genauigkeit erfordern, Achsen diverse Kleinteile. Die maximale Kranlast: 6,5 Tonnen. Auf Montage folgen Finish diverse Probeläufe. Erst umfangreicher Qualitätsprüfung zufrieden, verlassen Maschinen Werk. Auf Wunsch montieren testen Ihre Anlagen direkt Ort. Weltweit. Maschinenbau, Apparatebau Anlagenbau Impressum

Den behandelten Oberflächen sieht an. Doch professionelle Oberflächentechnik bloß richtige Lack. Alle beschichtenden Teile müssen zunächst fachlich korrekt vorbereitet werden. Unsere Mitarbeiter verwenden dafür Strahlmittel unterschiedlichster Intensität Wirkung, Beispiel Korund Glasperlen. Sie reinigen, sweepen, behandeln NE-Metalle tragen Bedarf Eisen-Dickschicht-Phosphatierung auf. Auf Gesamtfläche 1.500 Quadratmetern arbeiten ressourcen- umweltschonend , geht. Um Wasser sparen, fahren geschlossenen Kreislauf – heißt, bereiten Abwasser Wiederverwendung auf. Wir nutzen überwiegend Hydrolacke arbeiten VOC-Richtlinie . Auch hitzebeständige Lacke, Einschicht-, Struktur- Vakuumlacke Einsatz. Die behandelnden Produkte unterschiedlich – reichen gängigen Maschinenbauteilen über Offshore- Stahlwasserbauteile Elementen kerntechnischer Anlagen. Unsere Einstellung gleiche: Wir richten Ihren Wünschen. Maschinenbau, Apparatebau Anlagenbau Impressum

Kinkele // Schweißen Leistungen | Kapazitäten | Unternehmen | Referenzen | Medien | Kontakt | Imagefilm DE | EN Startseite > Kapazitäten > Schweißen Leistungen Maschinenbau Apparatebau Anlagenbau Schweißbau Projektmanagement Kaufteilmanagement Qualitätssicherung Kapazitäten Schweißen Zerspanen Lackieren Montieren Qualitätssicherung Unternehmen Aktuelles Chronik Karriere Downloads Zertifikate Links Referenzen Krane Hebezeuge - Seiltrommel Botlek Luft- Raumfahrtindustrie - Rahmen für Flugsimulator Energie- Elektrotechnik - Turbinenprüfstand Medien Katalog Maschinenliste Veröffentlichungen Video - Imagefilm Videos unseren Ausbildungsbereichen Kontakt Kontaktformular Anfahrt Imagefilm Imagefilm ansehen Schweißen 3 Roboter, 70 Mitarbeiter. In modernen Schweißbauhalle neueste technische Ausstattung an. Um schnell flexibel Wünsche Kunden reagieren können, setzen erfahrenes topqualifiziertes Personal. Unsere vornehmlich Haus ausgebildeten Schweißer Lage, komplexe Edelstahlapparate, schwere Maschinenbauteile fertigen. Gemeinsam Schweißfachingenieuren entwickeln realisieren optimale Lösungen ungeregelten geregelten Bereich (Luftfahrt, KTA) – mithilfe 20 Wandkränen 16 Brückenkränen. Dreidimensionale Visualisierungen Arbeitsplätzen ermöglichen uns, schwierigste Aufgaben kompetent sicher meistern. Wir bearbeiten Baugruppen 50 Tonnen Stückgewicht erreichen Schweißrobotersysteme für Einzelfertigung hohe Rationalisierungseffekte. Als Schweißfachbetrieb erfüllt KINKELE Bedingungen Großen Eignungsnachweises DIN 18800 T.7. Zudem verfügen über Erweiterung Schweißen CrNi-Stahl Bundesbahn-, Bundeswehr- HPO-Druckbehälter-Zulassung. Seit Ende Jahres 2012 Betrieb gemäß DIN EN 1090 zertifiziert. Technikbegeisterten jungen Menschen bieten verschiedene Berufseinstiegsmöglichkeiten. Die Ausbildung KINKELE praxisnah orientiert. Wir führen Azubis Tätigkeiten Maschinenbaus heran, stehen betreuend beratend Seite, fördern Talente lassen selbstständig arbeiten. Das umfangreiche Wissen, vermitteln, vielfältig Arbeitsumfeld. Auszubildende lernen Abteilungen Unternehmens kennen, Weise Fähigkeiten Interessen für spätere Einsatzgebiet entdecken. Angesprochen sind: Schüler(innen), Schülerpraktikum für interessanten Beruf näher kennenlernen möchten Student(inn)en, Praktikum Erfahrungen sammeln möchten Schulabsolvent(inn)en, Ausbildung Industriekaufmann/-frau, Technische(r) Produktdesigner(in), Verfahrensmechaniker(in) für Beschichtungstechnik oder Feinwerkmechaniker(in) Duales Studium (Bachelor of Engineering) beginnen möchten Sie Interesse? Wir fertigten für Hubbewegung notwendigen Herzstücke – insgesamt 16 Seiltrommeln. Die Anforderungen technische Lösung hoch: Bei Spannweiten Brücke 90 Meter Breite 50 Meter beträgt hebende Gewicht jeweils 4.850 Tonnen, entspricht Gesamtgewicht Eiffelturms (10.000 Tonnen)! Nicht bewegende Masse Häufigkeit Öffnungen beeindruckend: Die Brücke circa pro Stunde geöffnet, ergibt 9.000 Öffnungen pro Jahr. Die Montage Lagerungen Aufbringen 4x35 Meter Seil pro Trommel gehörten ebenfalls Lieferumfang. Zuverlässigkeit langjährige Einsatzfähigkeit harten Umweltbedingungen wichtigsten Anforderungen Bauteile. Um gewährleisten Beginn umfangreiches Fertigungswissen fertigenden Brückenbauteilen gesteckt. Über auswechselbare Messstrecken können verschiedenste Testturbinen untersucht werden. Die Testturbine geschlossenen Kreislauf trockener Luft angetrieben. Hier spielt Zuströmgehäuse wesentliche Rolle, Gehäuse unmittelbaren Einfluss Turbine zugeführten Volumenstrom Messungen Strömungsfeld stattfinden. Maschinenbau, Apparatebau Anlagenbau Impressum

Wir fertigten für Hubbewegung notwendigen Herzstücke – insgesamt 16 Seiltrommeln. Die Anforderungen technische Lösung hoch: Bei Spannweiten Brücke 90 Meter Breite 50 Meter beträgt hebende Gewicht jeweils 4.850 Tonnen, entspricht Gesamtgewicht Eiffelturms (10.000 Tonnen)! Nicht bewegende Masse Häufigkeit Öffnungen beeindruckend: Die Brücke circa pro Stunde geöffnet, ergibt 9.000 Öffnungen pro Jahr. Die Montage Lagerungen Aufbringen 4x35 Meter Seil pro Trommel gehörten ebenfalls Lieferumfang. Zuverlässigkeit langjährige Einsatzfähigkeit harten Umweltbedingungen wichtigsten Anforderungen Bauteile. Um gewährleisten Beginn umfangreiches Fertigungswissen fertigenden Brückenbauteilen gesteckt. Kinkele // Power Generation Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > References > Power Generation - Turbine test bench Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us #ref-slider ul {/* * Die width dynamisch berechnet werden: Anzahl 'li' mal 112px * Bei 10 Referenzen wären 1120px. */width: 560px; } machining quality testing assembling Power Generation Turbine test bench Our customer is constructing new turbine test bench to test turbines for aircraft engines and stationary gas turbines for power generation. This mechanism is able to simulate the most important flow parameters of cutting-edge, high-performance turbines. It enables elaborate measurements the flow field and at the test turbine itself. By means of exchangeable test sections and measurement paths, many different types of test turbines can be analysed. The test turbine is powered closed circuit with dry air. The inflow housing plays essential role at this point, since this housing has direct influence on the volume flow rate supplied to the turbine. Here is where the first measurements the flow field are conducted. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

The airplane cabin be placed on the frame. Then the frame and the cabin can be tilted at different angles to create realistic training environment for the crew. Our customer placed great value on the fact that we work compliance with the design, construction and safety standard DIN 15018. Kinkele // Cranes and Lifting Devices Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > References > Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us #ref-slider ul {/* * Die width dynamisch berechnet werden: Anzahl 'li' mal 112px * Bei 10 Referenzen wären 1120px. */width: 784px; } welding machining coating assembling quality testing Cranes and Lifting Devices Rope drum for the Botlek Bridge, Rotterdam NL The Botlek vertical lift bridge is superlative many ways—it is the heaviest lift bridge the world, yet it has the greatest lift frequency and the fastest lift speed. We manufactured the components at the heart of the lifting movement system—a total of 16 rope drums. The technical specifications of this project required extraordinary solutions: the two spans of the bridge are each 90 metres long and 50 metres wide, and the lift weight of each span is 4,850 tonnes—together, these weigh almost as much as the whole Eiffel Tower (10,000 tonnes)! The mass to be moved is impressive, but is the frequency of the openings. The bridge is opened approx. once per hour, which means 9,000 openings per year. The assembly of the mountings and the application of the 4x35 metres of rope per drum were part of this consignment. Reliability and long operational life despite harsh environmental conditions were among the most important requirements which each individual part had to fulfil. To achieve this, we applied our comprehensive manufacturing know-how to every one of the bridge components throughout the entire production process. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

The content is given the space it needs and it gives you the opportunity of getting to know KINKELE even better. Enjoy going through the site! Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Assembling Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > Capacities > Assembling Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us Assembling We put together what belongs together. In our 3-section assembly hall we assemble the entire spectrum of mechanical engineering – from the bulky installation to the delicate incidental part. The outcome: (special-purpose) machinery, installations and equipment with various types of hydraulic and pneumatic control systems. Large-scale and installation assembly area (2,250 m 2 ) Length 100 m | Width 22.5 m | Height of hall 17.5 m | Crane hook height 14 m This is where machinery (parts), fixtures and installations with weights up to 70 tons apiece are assembled, cabled and, if requested, placed into operation by our specialists. The high hall enables mobile cranes to be used without any difficulty the case of higher individual weights. Vacuum and materials handling equipment area (1,080 m 2 ) Length 48 m | Width 22.5m | Height of hall 10 m | Crane hook height 8.50 m This is where we assemble machines, machine parts, fixtures and integrated installations with individual weights up to 50 tons. Small-scale assembly area Length 24 m | Width 15 m | Height 5.50 m | Crane hook height 4.30 m Considerable precision is called for this assembly area – here we assemble machine parts which demand extremely high degree of exactness, such as axles and various incidental parts. Maximum crane load: 6.5 tons. The finish and various test runs follow on from assembly work. Only after extensive quality testing are we satisfied and only then do the machines leave our factory. If requested, we assemble and test your installations directly on the spot. Anywhere the world. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Paint Spraying Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > Capacities > Paint Spraying Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us Paint Spraying Our gloss comes out best our performance. You certainly notice the surfaces we have treated. But professional surface technology is more than just applying the right paint finish. All parts to be coated firstly need to be professionally prepared. For this, our employees make use of blasting abrasives of the most varied of intensities and impact, e.g. corundum or glass beads. They clean, sweep and treat NE metals and, if necessary, apply iron thick layer phosphating. Across total 1,500 sq.m. floor area we work as far as possible resource and environmentally compatible manner . To economise on water, we operate within closed cycle – this means that we condition our waste water for recycling. We mainly use hydro paints and work based on the VOC Directive . Heat-resistant paints, single coat, structure and vacuum spray paints are used. There are many types of products to be treated – from customary machinery parts and offshore and hydro-mechanical equipment through to elements of nuclear facilities. However, our attitude is one which never changes: we orientate ourselves totally to your requirements. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Welding Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > Capacities > Welding Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us Welding 3 robots, 70 employees. In our modern welded structures hall, it is not only matter of having the most up-to-date technical equipment. In order to react rapidly and flexibly to customer requests, we rely, particular, on experienced and highly qualified personnel. Our welders - most of whom are trained our company - manufacture both complex stainless steel equipment and heavy machinery parts. Together with the welding engineers, they devise and implement optimum solutions the non-controlled and state-controlled field (aviation, KTA - Nuclear engineering committee) – aided by 20 bracket-type cranes and 16 overhead cranes 3D visualisations at the work stations enable us to skilfully and securely master the most difficult of assignments. We process sub-assemblies of up to 50 tons apiece and thanks to our welding robot systems attain high degree of rationalisation - even with single-item manufacturing. As specialist welding company, KINKELE meets the conditions of the Special Welder´s Certificate acc. with DIN 18800 T.7. We have extension for welding CrNi steel and the Bundesbahn, Bundeswehr and HPO pressure vessel authorisations. Our company has been DIN EN 1090 -certified since the end of 2012. We undertake welding on the following materials: Steel General structural steels Heat-resistant steels Low-temperature structural steels Fine-grain structural steels up to S 960 Stainless steel and alloys Non-rusting steels Austenitic steels Austenitic-ferritic steels Nickel alloys Copper alloys Aluminium Alloys up to Materials Group 23 Titanium Alloys up to Materials Group 51 Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Power Generation Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > References > Power Generation - Turbine test bench Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us #ref-slider ul {/* * Die width dynamisch berechnet werden: Anzahl 'li' mal 112px * Bei 10 Referenzen wären 1120px. */width: 560px; } machining quality testing assembling Power Generation Turbine test bench Our customer is constructing new turbine test bench to test turbines for aircraft engines and stationary gas turbines for power generation. This mechanism is able to simulate the most important flow parameters of cutting-edge, high-performance turbines. It enables elaborate measurements the flow field and at the test turbine itself. By means of exchangeable test sections and measurement paths, many different types of test turbines can be analysed. The test turbine is powered closed circuit with dry air. The inflow housing plays essential role at this point, since this housing has direct influence on the volume flow rate supplied to the turbine. Here is where the first measurements the flow field are conducted. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Aerospace Industry Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > References > Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us #ref-slider ul {/* * Die width dynamisch berechnet werden: Anzahl 'li' mal 112px * Bei 10 Referenzen wären 1120px. */width: 672px; } welding machining coating quality testing Aerospace Industry Frame for flight simulator After welding and processing, this structure become the frame for flight simulator (Cabin Crew Trainer) for the drilling of flight attendants. The airplane cabin be placed on the frame. Then the frame and the cabin can be tilted at different angles to create realistic training environment for the crew. Our customer placed great value on the fact that we work compliance with the design, construction and safety standard DIN 15018. For our customer, Bosch Rexroth, we manufacture individual parts for the "Cabin Crew Trainer". Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint

Kinkele // Cranes and Lifting Devices Services | Capacities | Company | References | Media | Contact DE | EN Home > References > Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Services Mechanical Engineering Process Equipment Plant Construction Welded Structures Project Management Purchase Part Management Quality Maintenance Capacities Welding Machining Paint Spraying Assembling Quality Maintenance Company News Chronicle Career Downloads Certificates Links References Cranes and Lifting Devices - Rope drum, Botlek Bridge Aerospace Industry - Frame for flight simulator Power Generation - Turbine test bench Media Booklet Machine List Publishing Videos for Apprenticeship Contact Contact Form How to find us #ref-slider ul {/* * Die width dynamisch berechnet werden: Anzahl 'li' mal 112px * Bei 10 Referenzen wären 1120px. */width: 784px; } welding machining coating assembling quality testing Cranes and Lifting Devices Rope drum for the Botlek Bridge, Rotterdam NL The Botlek vertical lift bridge is superlative many ways—it is the heaviest lift bridge the world, yet it has the greatest lift frequency and the fastest lift speed. We manufactured the components at the heart of the lifting movement system—a total of 16 rope drums. The technical specifications of this project required extraordinary solutions: the two spans of the bridge are each 90 metres long and 50 metres wide, and the lift weight of each span is 4,850 tonnes—together, these weigh almost as much as the whole Eiffel Tower (10,000 tonnes)! The mass to be moved is impressive, but is the frequency of the openings. The bridge is opened approx. once per hour, which means 9,000 openings per year. The assembly of the mountings and the application of the 4x35 metres of rope per drum were part of this consignment. Reliability and long operational life despite harsh environmental conditions were among the most important requirements which each individual part had to fulfil. To achieve this, we applied our comprehensive manufacturing know-how to every one of the bridge components throughout the entire production process. Heavy engineering, process equipment Imprint
